env_local: marine pelagic feature [ENVO:01000044];marine water body [ENVO:00001999];costal water body [ENVO:02000049]
extra_site_info: Station L4 is part of the Western Channel Observatory (WCO) off Plymouth. The long-term ecological site has been studied for over a century, with plankton sampled from viruses, bacteria and fungi to large zooplankton and fish larvae. The site is also utilised for adult fish surveys and eDNA-based assessments of marine biodiversity. Station L4 is typically seasonally stratified and sometimes impacted by estuarine waters from the adjacent rivers Tamar and Plym. In a typical year, a spring diatom bloom is followed by Phaeocystis and other major phytoplankton groups including dinoflagellates. The site has been subjected to a broad range of omics and molecular-based studies, including metabarcoding, metagenomics and single-cell approaches.
